questions.question_text: A point is on the x-axis. What are its y-coordinate and z-coordinates?
hints: Recall properties of points on coordinate axes
On x-axis, both y and z coordinates are zero

questions.question_text: A point is in the XZ-plane. What can you say about its y-coordinate?
hints: Recall properties of points on coordinate planes
In XZ-plane, y-coordinate is zero
Use Table 11.1 for sign patterns
Check signs of x, y, z coordinates
Match with octant signs

questions.question_text: Fill in the blanks: (i) The x-axis and y-axis taken together determine a plane known as_______. (ii) The coordinates of points in the XY-plane are of the form _______. (iii) Coordinate planes divide the space into ______ octants.
hints: Recall definitions from section 11.2
XY-plane contains points with z=0
Three planes divide space into 8 parts

questions.question_text: Find the distance between the following pairs of points: (i) (2, 3, 5) and (4, 3, 1) (ii) (–3, 7, 2) and (2, 4, –1) (iii) (–1, 3, – 4) and (1, –3, 4) (iv) (2, –1, 3) and (–2, 1, 3).
hints: Use distance formula: √[(x₂-x₁)² + (y₂-y₁)² + (z₂-z₁)²]
Be careful with negative signs
Simplify radicals where possible

questions.question_text: Show that the points (–2, 3, 5), (1, 2, 3) and (7, 0, –1) are collinear.
hints: Calculate distances between all pairs
Check if sum of two distances equals third
Use distance formula from section 11.4

questions.question_text: Verify the following: (i) (0, 7, –10), (1, 6, – 6) and (4, 9, – 6) are the vertices of an isosceles triangle. (ii) (0, 7, 10), (–1, 6, 6) and (– 4, 9, 6) are the vertices of a right angled triangle. (iii) (–1, 2, 1), (1, –2, 5), (4, –7, 8) and (2, –3, 4) are the vertices of a parallelogram.
hints: For (i): Check if any two sides are equal
For (ii): Use Pythagoras theorem (check if a²+b²=c²)
For (iii): Show opposite sides are equal or diagonals bisect

questions.question_text: Find the equation of the set of points which are equidistant from the points (1, 2, 3) and (3, 2, –1).
hints: Let point be P(x,y,z)
Set PA = PB where A=(1,2,3), B=(3,2,-1)
Square both sides to eliminate square roots
Simplify to get linear equation

questions.question_text: Find the equation of the set of points P, the sum of whose distances from A (4, 0, 0) and B (– 4, 0, 0) is equal to 10.
hints: Let P(x,y,z)
Set PA + PB = 10
Use distance formula for PA and PB
Simplify to get equation in x,y,z

questions.question_text: Three vertices of a parallelogram ABCD are A(3, – 1, 2), B (1, 2, – 4) and C (– 1, 1, 2). Find the coordinates of the fourth vertex.
hints: Use property: diagonals bisect each other
Midpoint of AC = Midpoint of BD
Let D(x,y,z) and solve equations

questions.question_text: Find the lengths of the medians of the triangle with vertices A (0, 0, 6), B (0,4, 0) and (6, 0, 0).
hints: Find midpoints of sides using midpoint formula
Calculate distance from vertex to opposite midpoint
Use distance formula for each median

questions.question_text: If the origin is the centroid of the triangle PQR with vertices P (2a, 2, 6), Q (– 4, 3b, –10) and R(8, 14, 2c), then find the values of a, b and c.
hints: Use centroid formula: ((x₁+x₂+x₃)/3, (y₁+y₂+y₃)/3, (z₁+z₂+z₃)/3)
Set centroid = (0,0,0)
Solve three equations for a, b, c

questions.question_text: If A and B be the points (3, 4, 5) and (–1, 3, –7), respectively, find the equation of the set of points P such that PA² + PB² = k², where k is a constant.
hints: Let P(x,y,z)
Write expressions for PA² and PB²
Add them and set equal to k²
Simplify to get equation in x,y,z
